body_html: For the incomplete aten::relu fusion, the reason is that aten::gt op fell out of the special matching condition here https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/csrc/jit/passes/graph_fuser.cpp#L225-L239. The problem is, when I add it back, I have some "invalid context" errors in my toy example, which are likely orthogonal and have been exposed just by fused kernel being the first thing that a backward thread is running.
body_text: For the incomplete aten::relu fusion, the reason is that aten::gt op fell out of the special matching condition here https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/csrc/jit/passes/graph_fuser.cpp#L225-L239. The problem is, when I add it back, I have some "invalid context" errors in my toy example, which are likely orthogonal and have been exposed just by fused kernel being the first thing that a backward thread is running.
body: For the incomplete aten::relu fusion, the reason is that aten::gt op fell out of the special matching condition here https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/csrc/jit/passes/graph_fuser.cpp#L225-L239. The problem is, when I add it back, I have some "invalid context" errors in my toy example, which are likely orthogonal and have been exposed just by fused kernel being the first thing that a backward thread is running.
